title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.4 - Penalty for failure by Sandy Hook or Hell Gate pilot to board inward-bound vessel
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.4 - Penalty for failure by Sandy Hook or Hell Gate pilot to board inward-bound vessel

State Regulations

Sandy Hook pilots and Hell Gate pilots are required to board
the nearest inward-bound vessel displaying a signal for a pilot unless there be
in sight a vessel showing a signal of distress. Failure to comply with this
section will subject the pilot so failing to a penalty of
$50. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
56.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
